Term algorithms

Types

Failure = ref object of CatchableError
TermKind = enum
  tkVariable, tkFunctor, tkConstant, tkPlaceholder
Term[Sym; Val] = object
  case kind: TermKind
  of tkVariable:
      name: Sym
      genIdx: int

  of tkFunctor:
      sym: Sym
      subt: seq[Term[Sym, Val]]

  of tkConstant:
      value: Val

  of tkPlaceholder:
      nil

  
TermEnv[Sym; Val] = object
  values: Table[Term[Sym, Val], Term[Sym, Val]]

RedSystem[Sym; Val] = object
  rules: Table[Term[Sym, Val], Term[Sym, Val]]

    Sys, Val]
Create new environment using values as initial binding values

proc `[]=`[Sym, Val](env: var TermEnv[Sym, Val]; variable, value: Term[Sym, Val]): void

Hash for term. 
proc copy[Sym, Val](term: Term[Sym, Val]; env: TermEnv[Sym, Val]): (
    Term[Sym, Val], TermEnv[Sym, Val])
Create copy of a term. All variables are replaced with new ones. 
proc dereference[Sym, Val](term: Term[Sym, Val]; env: TermEnv[Sym, Val]): Term[
    Sym, Val]
Traverse binding chain in environment env and return value of the term

                    env: TermEnv[Sym, Val] = makeEnvironment[Sym, Val]()): TermEnv[
    Sym, Val]

    (Term[Sym, Var], TermPath)]
Output list of all variables in term

                     value: Term[Sym, Val]): void
proc substitute[Sym, Val](term: Term[Sym, Val]; env: TermEnv[Sym, Val]): Term[
    Sym, Val]
Substitute all variables in term with their values from environment 
proc reduce[Sym, Val](term: Term[Sym, Val]; system: RedSystem[Sym, Val]): (
    Term[Sym, Val], bool)

func `==`[Sym, Val](t1, t2: Term[Sym, Val]): bool
Check if two terms are identical, regardless of the environemtn value.
